s.text: Dear Sir, I am writing to thank you for bouncing the cheque with which I endeavoured to pay my plumber last month.

To this end, please be advised about the following: First, I have noticed that whereas I personally attend to your telephone calls and letters, when I try to contact you I am confronted by the impersonal, ever-changing, pre-recorded, faceless entity which your bank has become.

To transfer the call to my living room in case I am there; Extension of living room to be communicated at the time the call is received.

Said in Court These are things people actually said in court, word for word, taken down and now published by court reporters who had the torment of staying calm while these exchanges were actually taking place: Q: What was the first thing your husband said to you when he woke that morning?
